00001 /*! \file 
00002     \brief Holds declarations for the memory sub-system. */
00003 
00004 #ifndef _MM_H_
00005 #define _MM_H_
00006 
00007 /* Macro definitions. */
00008 
00009 #define MAX_NUMBER_OF_FRAMES    (32*1024*1024/(4*1024))
00010 /*!< The maximum number of page frames the system can support. */
00011 
00012 #define ALLOCATE_FLAG_KERNEL             (4)
00013 /*!< Set if the memory block can only be de-allocated by the kernel. */
00014 
00015 /*! This Macro extends the flags defined for the p_flags in the ELF program
00016    header entries. */
00017 #define PF_KERNEL 0x8 /*!< Segment can only be accessed from the kernel. */
00018 
00019 #define GET_PTE_ENTRY_POINTER(page_table, addr) \
00020  ((unsigned long *)(((page_table)+3*4*1024+(((addr)>>9)&(-8)))))
00021 /*!< Macro returning the pointer to a PTE entry holding information on
00022      the page with address addr in the page table with address page_table. 
00023      Used in task A4. */
00024 
00025 /* Type declarations. */
00026 
00027 /*! Defines a page frame. */
00028 struct page_frame
00029 {
00030  int             owner; /*!< Index into the process table. The index
00031                              corresponds to the owning process. */
00032  int             start; /*!< Index into the page frame table. The index
00033                              corresponds to the start of the reserved
00034                              memory block. */
00035  int             free_is_allowed; /*!< Flag that is zero if the page must 
00036                                        not be de-allocated with free. */
00037 };
00038 
00039 /*! Defines a page-map level-4 table, a page-directory pointer table,
00040     a page-directory table, or a page table. */
00041 struct page_table
00042 {
00043  unsigned long   entries[512];
00044 };
00045 
00046 /* Variable declarations. */
00047 
00048 extern struct page_frame
00049 page_frame_table[MAX_NUMBER_OF_FRAMES];
00050 /*!< Array holding information on all the page frames in physical memory. */
00051 
00052 extern unsigned long
00053 first_available_memory_byte;
00054 /*!< The address of the first memory byte that is not used by the kernel. */
00055 
00056 extern const unsigned long
00057 memory_size;
00058 /*!< Size, in bytes, of the memory. */
00059 
00060 extern unsigned long
00061 memory_pages;
00062 /*!< Size, in pages, of the memory. */
00063 
00064 extern const unsigned long
00065 kernel_page_table_root;
00066 /*!< The address of the page table tree that the kernel installs when 
00067      booting. */
00068 
00069 /* Function declarations. */
00070 
00071 /*! Allocates a memory block. 
00072     \return an address to the memory block or an error code if
00073             the allocation was not successful. */
00074 extern long
00075 kalloc(const register unsigned long length
00076         /*!< The number of bytes to allocate. */,
00077        const register unsigned int  process
00078         /*!< The process for which memory is to be allocated. */,
00079        const register unsigned long flags
00080         /*!< Flags indicating the type of memory block to allocate.*/);
00081 
00082 /*! De-allocates a memory block previously allocated via kalloc.
00083     \return 0 if sucessful or an error code if not successful. */
00084 extern long
00085 kfree(const register unsigned long address
00086        /*!< The address of the memory block to free. */);
00087 
00088 /*! Change the protection of a range of pages in a page table. To
00089     be implemented in task A4. */
00090 extern void
00091 update_memory_protection(const register unsigned long page_table
00092                           /*!< Address of the page table to update. */,
00093                          const register unsigned long start_address
00094                           /*!< Address to the first page to update. */,
00095                          const register unsigned long length
00096                           /*!< Total number of bytes to update. */,
00097                          const register unsigned long flags
00098                           /*!< A set of flags showing the protection to
00099                                use on the pages. */);
00100 
00101 /*! Initialize the memory protection system. To be implemented in task A4. */
00102 extern void
00103 initialize_memory_protection();
